com.jacobschneider.engine.math.boundingvolumes

Class BoundVolume

  • Object
    • BoundVolume
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BoundCircle, BoundNull, BoundSphere

    public abstract class BoundVolume
extends Object
    Represents a bounding volume around a physical object (usually a Shape object). Objects of this type should be mutable and created once at the beginning of a Body's existence. If you create a subclass of this class you MUST add corresponding overlap strategies to putStrategy(OverlapStrategy) BEFORE you instantiate an object of that subclass. At a minimum you must create strategies between all the implementations you make and between your implementations and BoundSphere and BoundCircle. If you attempt to create a BoundVolume subclass that does not have a corresponding OverlapStrategy for all possible situations placed in putStrategy(OverlapStrategy) an IllegalStateException will be thrown as soon as the object is created.
    Author:
    Jacob

        public BoundVolume()

    • Method Detail

      • putStrategy

        protected static void putStrategy(OverlapStrategy strat)
        Places a new strategy into the strategy container. In order for a bounding volume to be used is must have all possible overlap strategies implemented and placed into this method.
        Parameters:
        strat - The overlap strategy to be put in the container

      • testOverlap

        public final boolean testOverlap(BoundVolume other)
        Tests if this volume overlaps another volume. Any test involving BoundNull returns false.
        Parameters:
        other - The volume to test against.
        Returns:
        True if volumes intersect, otherwise false

      • updateState

        public abstract void updateState(Vector3 x,
                                 Quaternion q)
        Updates the position and orientation of this bounding volume. The positions is defined as the center of mass (origin) of the volume.
        Parameters:
        x - New origin of this volume.
        q - New orientation of this volume.
